verses.verse: To the chief Musician<WH5329> upon<WH5921> Sheminith,<WH8067> A Psalm<WH4210> of David.<WH1732> Help,<WH3467> LORD;<WH3068> for<WH3588> the godly man<WH2623> ceaseth;<WH1584> for<WH3588> the faithful<WH539> fail<WH6461> from among the children<WH4480> <WH1121> of men.<WH120>
They speak<WH1696> vanity<WH7723> every one<WH376> with<WH854> his neighbor:<WH7453> with flattering<WH2513> lips<WH8193> and with a double heart<WH3820> <WH3820> do they speak.<WH1696>
The LORD<WH3068> shall cut off<WH3772> all<WH3605> flattering<WH2513> lips,<WH8193> and the tongue<WH3956> that speaketh<WH1696> proud things: <WH1419>
Who <WH834> have said,<WH559> With our tongue<WH3956> will we prevail;<WH1396> our lips<WH8193> are our own: who<WH4310> is lord<WH113> over us?

For the oppression<WH4480> <WH7701> of the poor,<WH6041> for the sighing<WH4480> <WH603> of the needy,<WH34> now<WH6258> will I arise,<WH6965> saith<WH559> the LORD;<WH3068> I will set<WH7896> him in safety<WH3468> from him that puffeth<WH6315> at him.
The words<WH565> of the LORD<WH3068> are pure<WH2889> words:<WH565> as silver<WH3701> tried<WH6884> in a furnace<WH5948> of earth,<WH776> purified<WH2212> seven<WH7659> times.
Thou <WH859> shalt keep<WH8104> them, O LORD,<WH3068> thou shalt preserve<WH5341> them from<WH4480> this<WH2098> generation<WH1755> forever.<WH5769>
The wicked<WH7563> walk<WH1980> on every side,<WH5439> when the vilest<WH2149> men<WH120> are exalted.<WH7311>
